bibdata.title: IEEE Standard for Measuring the Effectiveness of Electromagnetic Shielding Enclosures
IEEE Standard for Measuring the Effectiveness of Electromagnetic Shielding Enclosures

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: Uniform measurement procedures and techniques are provided for determining the effectiveness of electromagnetic shielding enclosures at frequencies from 9 kHz to 18 GHz (extendable to 50 Hz and 100 GHz, respectively) for enclosures having no dimension less than 2.0 m. The types of enclosures covered include, but are not limited to, single-shield or double-shield structures of various construction, such as bolted demountable, welded, or integral with a building; and made of materials such as steel plate, copper or aluminum sheet, screening, hardware cloth, metal foil, or shielding fabrics.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
